text:
Rings of Guilt

Dimly lit room; Raskolnikov in distress.  
A heavy silence looms.  
Raskolnikov: “Behind the door? Lying behind the door?”  
Razumihin: “What’s wrong?”  
Raskolnikov: “Nothing...”  

---  

Tension builds; Razumihin and Zossimov exchange glances.  
Razumihin: “He must have woken from a dream.”  
Zossimov: “What next?”  

---  

Flashback; Raskolnikov remembers the ear-rings.  
Raskolnikov: “I found them in the street!”  
Razumihin: “And why didn’t you go to the police?”  
Raskolnikov: “I was frightened!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov's anxiety and guilt manifest as he grapples with the implications of the ear-rings found in connection to a murder.
